messages.subject: Re: Get rid of dairy (was Re: Sinus infection)
messages.messageBody:
<<<<Here I go again, but it's true for me and many
others I know. Get off
all dairy and beef for a few months. Let your system
clear out. I had
years of sinus infections until I got rid of dairy.

Kathy B.>>>>

Everytime I eat too much dairy (like an ice cream
binge - my downfall <vbg>) my sinuses get very blocked
up. I would not have recognised the connection had I
not gone off dairy while breastfeeding my dd.

Meghan

messages.subject: Get rid of dairy (was Re: Sinus infection)
messages.msgSnippet: ... Here I go again, but it s true for me and many others I know. Get off all dairy and beef for a few months. Let your system clear out. I had years of sinus
messages.messageBody:
--- In Unschooling-dotcom@y..., Jessi <mistycal@b...> wrote:
> I know that many of you here are into natural healing...any ideas on how to
> get rid of one without going on antibiotics?
>
> Thanks!
>
> Jessi

Here I go again, but it's true for me and many others I know. Get off
all dairy and beef for a few months. Let your system clear out. I had
years of sinus infections until I got rid of dairy.

Kathy B.

messages.subject: Re: Sinus infection
messages.msgSnippet: ... I m not at all into natural healing, but I get sinus infections with charming regularity about four times a year, so I know how to deal with them sans
messages.messageBody:
----------
>From: Unschooling-dotcom@yahoogroups.com
>To: Unschooling-dotcom@yahoogroups.com
>Subject: [Unschooling-dotcom] Digest Number 1624
>Date: Mon, Nov 26, 2001, 10:24 AM
>

> I know that many of you here are into natural healing...any ideas on how to
> get rid of one without going on antibiotics?


I'm not at all into natural healing, but I get sinus infections with
charming regularity about four times a year, so I know how to deal with them
sans antibiotics.

I sometimes use sudafed and tylenol for a few days if the pain is bad, and
after that I drink a LOT of hot tea and hot chocolate to "break things up".

They always cure themselves this way after about five or six days, about two
of those days are feverish enough that I don't drive, etc.

Pam

messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Sinus infection
messages.msgSnippet: I used goldenseal to get rid of a sinus infection a few years ago. It s probably not a good choice if you have high blood pressure.  Ask at your health food
messages.messageBody:
I used goldenseal to get rid of a sinus infection a few years ago.
It's probably not a good choice if you have high blood pressure. Ask at
your health food store for a good organic, cultivated variety as the wild
plant is endangered. You can buy it in capsule form. It burns a little
in the tummy,so eat first. Also, have you tried a Netti pot? (sp) I've
never used one but have heard good things about them.
Sinus infections hurt like heck! I hope you feel better soon.
Deb L

messages.subject: Re: Sinus infection
messages.msgSnippet: (sorry if this is a duplicate. First try didn t seem to go through) My doctor stresses using a humidifier during the cold months to ease sinus problems. Also,
messages.messageBody:
(sorry if this is a duplicate. First try didn't seem to go through)
My doctor stresses using a humidifier during the cold months to ease
sinus problems.
Also, my dd recommends Zicam, a non-prescription drug found in most
drug stores.
Sarah

messages.msgSnippet: ... I don t know what country you live in. But if you can get some Canadian Oxen Gallstone Powder from your local Asian herb shop, that ll do the trick. Its
messages.messageBody:
>Jessi writes:
>I know that many of you here are into natural healing...any ideas on how to
>get rid of one without going on antibiotics?


I don't know what country you live in. But if you can get some Canadian
Oxen Gallstone Powder from your local Asian herb shop, that'll do the
trick. Its pricey, but it won't suppress the immune system into forming
some awful dis-ease later down the road.


k
